TextBody:
Hello Itay,

Thank you for contacting us.

Could you please provide us more details in regards of your compatibility inquiry?

We are not sure exactly what does the abbreviation VC could mean so we would appreciate if you could let us know as many details about this as possible.

Looking forward to your response.

Best Regards,
Marian Ilies | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.netwrix.com

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000NIglf:ref

Hi Marian,

VC means Vcenter of VMware.
Please refer to the ESXi too.(also version 8)
The details of the server and the client of EP are in the case details.

BR,
Itay.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #439887 -  - Compatibility    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0NIglf:ref ]

TextBody:
Hello Itay,

Thank you for following up on this.

To respond to your inquiry, you do not need to upgrade the EPP version for this, but we strongly recommend to upgrade the server version if possible to at least 5.9.0.0, ideally to 5.9.4.1 to benefit of the latest updates.

Also, if you wish to upgrade the server version, make sure first you take a snapshot of the EPP virtual appliance in your virtualization environment and also make sure you have a back up v2 in place so in case anything happens you can rely on them to restore the instance.

Looking forward to your response.

Best Regards,
Marian Ilies | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.netwrix.com
